input_text:
Job Title: Content Creator

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Content Creator, Motion Design

About Ogilvy

Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry.

About The Role

As a Content Creator, Motion Design, you understand how to shoot and edit captivating stories for the social space. You will play a key role in creating platform-first social content in English and Spanish that will provide our followers and fans with a thoughtful point of view in a relatable and authentic way.

You will collaborate with your partners in account management, social strategy and creative to define and deliver digital content that inspires loyal customer and prospect engagement. You will be working in a fast-paced environment on one of our fastest growing accounts with a intercultural focus. Direction can change in a heartbeat, and you will take each change in stride, maintaining focus on delivering dynamic and innovative content!

What You’ll Do

Develop and deliver creative output for client from creative concepting through shooting, editing and animationWorking with the community manager, concept content for social channels either at a post or campaign levelCreate content in both English and SpanishEdit raw video footage and add effects/elements with motion graphics to enhance creative output.Design & produce animated video content from scratch with minimal existing footage (eg. vector illustrations turned into an animated video).Assist in creating video treatments and storyboards for video ideas.Develop design aesthetics that align with client brand identity and guidelines on all projects.Actively propose styles of motion graphics to improve the quality of content.Work with art and creative teams to understand project scope and objectives, and actively contribute in the creative brainstorm/development process.Mentor and share knowledge with more junior members of the creative team.Be an active advocate of anything and everything that’s creatively inspiring.

What You’ll Need

Fluent in Spanish (spoken and written)Minimum of 3 years in a content creation and/or motion designer role.Experience with fundamentals of cinematography, especially lighting.Familiarity with at least one major motion camera platform (Canon, RED, Arri or similar).Familiarity with modern lighting systems (e.g. Skypanels, LED Fresnels, 1x1s) a major plus.Proficiency in Adobe Premiere and Adobe Creative Suite. Especially After Effects for motion design or similar programs.Must have excellent design, typography, and layout skills. Attention to detail is critical.Knowledge on the various social media platforms specifically best practices.Excellent time management skills and experience working to tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.An energetic team player, with a can-do attitude and a positive personality.

How We’ll Support You

Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.

At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression.

We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality.

Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve. This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Experience Level (if available): None
